posts.summary:
The UK’s Project Gigabit programme remains one of the most ambitious infrastructure initiatives ever undertaken, with the goal of delivering gigabit-capable broadband to some of the hardest-to-reach communities in the country.
While significant progress has been made, millions of premises remain unbuilt across rural and semi-rural areas. For contractors and delivery partners involved in these programmes, the challenge is no longer just about securing work — it’s about delivering at scale, at pace, and under increasing scrutiny.

The reality on the ground
Project Gigabit delivery is characterised by:
• Complex, dispersed build areas.
• Multiple delivery lots and overlapping contracts.
• Tight build windows and milestone-based funding
• Increasing focus on assurance, reporting and compliance
• Pressure on productivity, resourcing and commercial control
As programmes mature, expectations rise. Authorities, suppliers and delivery partners all require clear evidence of progress, control and compliance — not just outputs at the end of the build.

Where delivery starts to strain
Many contractors are still relying on:
• Spreadsheets for tracking progress and resources
• Disconnected GIS, permit and field systems.
• Manual reporting for assurance and governance
• Limited real-time visibility of site activity
These approaches can work at small scale, but Project Gigabit demands consistency and control across hundreds or thousands of premises, often spread across wide geographies.

This is where delivery risk increases:
• Delays are harder to spot early.
• Productivity issues surface too late.
• Permit and site data becomes fragmented.
• Reporting becomes reactive rather than proactive.

How Glidepath supports Project Gigabit delivery
Glidepath was designed specifically for utilities and fibre-network delivery programmes operating at scale.
For contractors working on Project Gigabit schemes, Glidepath provides:
• A single operational view of planned, live and completed works.
• Direct integration with GIS systems to reflect real network progress.
• End-to-end management of work instructions permits and site activity.
• Real-time visibility of crew activity, delays and risks
• Structured capture of site evidence and audit records
• Clear reporting that supports assurance, governance and funding milestones

Rather than replacing existing systems, Glidepath connects planning, field delivery and management oversight, helping teams stay in control as programmes grow in size and complexity.

Supporting delivery — not adding overhead
One of the biggest concerns for contractors is introducing new systems mid-programme. Glidepath is built to be:
• Quick to implement.
• Simple for field teams to adopt.
• Flexible enough to align with existing delivery models.
The aim is not to add bureaucracy, but to reduce manual effort, improve visibility and give delivery teams the confidence that nothing critical is being missed.

Looking ahead
With large volumes of Project Gigabit premises still to be delivered, the coming years will be defined by:
• Sustained build intensity
• Increased focus on performance and assurance
• The need for scalable, repeatable delivery models
Contractors that can demonstrate control, transparency and consistency will be best placed to succeed as the programme continues.

Want to learn more?
If you’re involved in Project Gigabit delivery and want to understand how Glidepath can support your operational management, get in touch or explore the platform further on our website.
